name: PVInstance
type: class
memorycategory: Instances
summary: |
  Abstract class for all objects that have a physical location in the world.
description: |
  A Class.PVInstance is an abstract class that cannot be created. It is the
  base for all objects that have a physical location in the world.
codesamples: []

methods:
  - name: PVInstance:GetPivot
    summary: |
      Gets the pivot of a Class.PVInstance.
    description: |
      This function gets the pivot of a Class.PVInstance. This is often used
      with Class.PVInstance:PivotTo() to move a model.

      Class.Model|Models and Class.BasePart|BaseParts are both
      Class.PVInstance|PVInstances ("Position Velocity Instances") and so both
      have this function.
    codesamples:
      - simple-character-teleportation
    parameters: []
    returns:
      - type: CFrame
        summary: ''
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security: None
    threadsafety: Safe
    capabilities: []
  - name: PVInstance:PivotTo
    summary: |
      Transforms the Class.PVInstance along with all of its descendant
      Class.PVInstance|PVInstances such that the pivot is now located at the
      specified Datatype.CFrame.
    description: |
      Transforms the Class.PVInstance along with all of its descendant
      Class.PVInstance|PVInstances such that the pivot is now located at the
      specified Datatype.CFrame. This is the primary function that should be
      used to move Class.Model|Models via scripting.

      Class.BasePart|BaseParts are moved in this way by having their
      Datatype.CFrame transformed by the necessary offset.
      Class.Model|Models are moved in this way by having their
      Class.Model.WorldPivot transformed by the necessary offset.

      Note that for efficiency purposes, Class.Object.Changed events are not
      fired for Class.BasePart.Position|Position and
      Class.BasePart.Orientation|Orientation of Class.BasePart|BaseParts
      moved in this way; they are only fired for Datatype.CFrame.

      When calling Class.PVInstance:PivotTo()|PivotTo on Class.Model|Models,
      the offsets of the descendant parts and models are cached, such that
      subsequent calls to Class.PVInstance:PivotTo()|PivotTo on the same model
      do not accumulate floating point drift between the parts making up the
      model.

      Class.Model|Models and Class.BasePart|BaseParts are both
      Class.PVInstance|PVInstances ("Position Velocity Instances") and so both
      have this function.
    codesamples:
      - simple-character-teleportation
    parameters:
      - name: targetCFrame
        type: CFrame
        default:
        summary: |
          The Datatype.CFrame that the Class.PVInstance pivot should equal
          after moving it.
    returns:
      - type: ()
        summary: ''
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security: None
    threadsafety: Unsafe
    capabilities: []
events: []
callbacks: []
